title: Upper-Intermediate English 410
headline: This free online English course explains the grammar of mixed conditionals and provides vocabulary related to health.
description: This English course introduces you to vocabulary related to health and medicine. We also explain how to use zero, first, second, and third conditionals in the affirmative or negative and how to use them to form questions. We examine the grammar practices of mixed third/second conditionals to discuss the impact of past actions on the present. Learn English with these classes and confidently boost your ability to discuss health and wellbeing.
courseDescription:
In this English course, we will introduce you to vocabulary related to health, wellness, and healthcare. Not only will there be a focus on common health issues and disorders but also on a variety of treatments that could help manage or potentially cure these conditions.

We then use your newly acquired words and phrases to demonstrate the grammatical rules surrounding conditionals. We explain using zero, first, second, and third conditionals in statements, negatives, and question forms. We then go over the use of mixed conditionals and show you how to combine third/second and second/third conditionals. This particular grammar point will focus on using these mixed conditionals to discuss how past actions impact the present.

In our ‘Resources’ section, we present tasks geared towards helping you practice, develop, and enhance your English reading, listening, and speaking abilities. We also include helpful tips to guide your writing activities, mainly focusing on the ending and an effective concluding paragraph that leaves a reader with a lasting impression. Enroll for this English course to take a significant step forward towards becoming proficient in this global language.
